result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: appointing Atty Dolfi.  gll
re: No contact with A. B. Filed by DE. arc   to kp

- $750 already on file, posted on 8/1/22. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A. Bandel.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:13 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicholas Mark Peterson appeared by video.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nicholas Mark Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE does qualify for PD. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all 3 counts.  Bond argument. Atty Dolfi asking to have a no abusive contact.  Court informs Atty Dolfi to file bond modification motion if needed.  Court orders bond.  DE to be here to sign bond by 3:30 PM on 9/9/22, if DE does not come in person to sign bond a warrant will be issued. Adjourned at 2:22 PM.
